page.title: 11Southampton Water
page.content: Southampton Water stretches from Calshot spit north-west,until it reaches the confluence of the Rivers Test and Itchen.From the marine terminal which is owned by the Esso oil Refinery you can see all sorts of ships going by.The marine terminal is used as a place for oil tankers to dock.There are the ferries the hydrofoil and the hovercraft.These include the Brittany,Hythe and the Red Funnel Ferries.Also you would see luxury liners such as the Q.E.2.and the Canberra,leisure boats such as yachts and speed boats will also go by.There are cargo boats called containers,they got there name from the metal boxes they carry.One ship is docked permanently it is called the Burmah Endeavour it is a quater of a mile.Along Southampton Water are lights called beacons which show ships
